Author: reidman
Content:
Definitely getting tired of this martyrdom fantasy where people post an opinion followed by something along the lines of "Go ahead and mod me down for having the bravery and courage to speak out against the vile things of this world which you sheeple blindly accept!"

And, no, I'm not going to tack it to the end of my post because it's so annoying that it's immune to ironic mockery :(

Author: codesurgeon
Title: EclipseDay at the Googleplex
Content: I have co-organized an Eclipse conference at Google, scheduled for June 24th at the Googleplex in Mountain View, CA. The focus of the talks is more hands-on than what you might have experienced at EclipseCon. It should prove to be particularly insightful for those of you using Eclipse for development purposes and maybe to a minor extent also for those building products on the platform. I just wanted to ping the hacker news community about the limited attendee list filling up fast - let me know if you want to come and I can try to sneak a couple of hacks in.

Author: rms
Content:
I had a friend who graduated from college in Macedonia. Each class was an exam which you took whenever you were ready to and the exams were offered every semester. So to get the degree you needed to take all of the relevant exams.

Not sure if anywhere else in Europe does things this way.

Content:

Author: jauco
Content: Try reading up on latent semantic analysis. It also uses vector calculus, but works a bit different IIRC. It can be used to identify words that are used in the same context and therefore should be the same. I'm not sure if it is directly applicable for recipes because of the concise language, but you might find interesting related articles.

Author: iamdave
Content: I agree, and flawless execution contrasting the Mars landing and Twitter operation. You couldn't ask for a more appropriate response.

Author: tlb
Content: I'm working on a big piece of software with numerical, real-time, and GTK components. It needs 230 packages installed using MacPorts. I have a 20-line script, mostly "port install XXX" which takes care of it all with no worries. And it's really nice that I can just rm -r /opt and do it again if I mess it up.

Author: ben_h
Content: If you're going to serve Javascript over SSL, you need a full SSL setup including a valid certificate, etc. If you have that, you may as well just serve the login form itself over HTTPS, redirecting back to HTTP after logging the user in, and forget the Javascript altogether.
